result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D Trott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.
*6/27/2016 credit amended to 180 days.  Order signed by Judge Paul J. Rifelj.
Court waived mandatory costs and surcharges including DNA due to defendant's financial and mental instability.

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence adjustment is DENIED by the Court, because it is not in the public interest. Order received, signed, and filed with the court.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jean Kies, Br. 45, for review. mag

Signed and filed: Decision and Order Granting Motion for Sentence Credit.

THEREFORE IT IS HEREBY ORDERED, that the defendant is granted a TOTAL of 180 days of sentence credit on Count One.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Paul J. Rifelj, Branch 31, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.
No reply from defendant or surety. DZ
No reply from defendant or surety. DZ
No reply from defendant or surety. DZ
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($350.00 = $225.00 + $25.00 + $100.00) gj

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS/MONTHS with 97 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.
*   Court WAIVED mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) 
       due to defendant's financial and mental instability.
20 day appeal rights given

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek postconviction Relief.

Defendant Joseph D Trott in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Joseph D Trott in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Joseph D Trott not in court, in custody and not produced.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 31.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping. 

**Defendant ordered to pay an additional $500.00 cash above any bail that remains on deposit**
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Walmart ALL stores in Milwaukee County
